edu.uci.ics.luci.lucicabinet
Class HDB_LUCI_Remote

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.ics.luci.lucicabinet.DB_LUCI
      edu.uci.ics.luci.lucicabinet.HDB_LUCI_Remote

public class HDB_LUCI_Remote
extends DB_LUCI

This class enables synchronized and asynchronous access to a tokyo-cabinet database over a socket connection. The expected use is that the remote end would be running the Butler class and that this class would connect to it.

Constructor Detail

HDB_LUCI_Remote

public HDB_LUCI_Remote(java.lang.String host,
                       java.lang.Integer port)
                throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                       java.io.IOException
This method opens a socket connection and read/write stream to a remote server running a Butler service.

Parameters:
host - The remote host to connect to, e.g. "localhost", "192.128.1.20"
port - The port that the remote host is listening on.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException
java.io.IOException - thrown if the remote host doesn't respond with the expected handshake.

shutdown

protected void shutdown()
Gives all asynchronous operations up to 2 minutes to complete then tells the remote server that this connection is shutting down, then cleans up all the resources created by this class.

public void removeSync(byte[] key)
A synchronous remove command. Does not return until command is complete.

Parameters:
key - the entry to remove

removeAsync

public void removeAsync(byte[] key)
An asynchronous remove command. Runs on a separate thread.

Parameters:
key - the entry to remove

checkForError

iterateSync

public IteratorWorker iterateSync(IteratorWorker iw)
Synchronously run a job that iterates through all the entries in the database. Since the IteratorWorker may have internal state that the caller wants to access after the iteration, the returned value is the IteratorWorker after iterations.

Parameters:
iw - a class representing the work to be done.
Returns:
the IteratorWorker after the work is complete.

iterateAsync

private void iterateAsync(IteratorWorker iw)
Asynchronously run a job that iterates through all the entries in the database. No state is returned and the internal state of iw is never changed because it is sent remotely to do it's work.

Parameters:
iw - a class representing the work to be done.

iterate

public void iterate(IteratorWorker iw)
Asynchronously iterate over the entries in the database and call the appropriate methods in iw to do work. See IteratorWorker for details on how the iteration works. If there is information to be returned or collected, consider using 
iterateSync
.

Specified by:
iterate in class DB_LUCI
Parameters:
iw -
